product_name: Estee LauderDouble Wear Stay-in-Place Matte Powder Foundation
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingEstée Lauder's high performance, 12-hour color-true multi-dimensional Double Wear Stay-in-Place Matte Powder Foundation creates an instant matte transformation. This medium to full coverage powder foundation blends seamlessly and controls oil and shine, resulting a flawless matte finish.
details: DetailsBenefits12-hour wearVelvet soft; feels weightless & ultra comfortableOil control, instantly & for 12 hoursStays color true for 12 hoursSweat & humidity-resistant12-hour fade resistant12-hour non-settling12-hour non-creasing12-hour non-caking12-hour non-streakingResists poring for 12 hoursWon't cause breakouts, won't clog pores (non-acnegenic)FeaturesBorn from a creamour Dual Fusion Process it unites emollients with pigments to help create this high-performance, microfine powder foundationOil-freeWaterproofDermatologist testedIncludes a two-sided applicator for custom, buildable coverage with this medium to full coverage powder foundationRefillable compact feels sleek & sensual in your handsItem 2638246How To UseCustomize your coverage with the two-sided applicator:Use the sponge side to apply this medium to full coverage powder foundation all over face.Use the velvety side for softer coverage or targeted areas.IngredientsSynthetic Fluorphlogopite, Zinc Stearate, Boron Nitride, Silica, Alumina, Polyglyceryl3 Diisostearate, Lauroyl Lysine, Butylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate, Magnesium Carbonate, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Tocopherol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Dimer Dilinoleyl Dimer Dilinoleate. May Contain (+/-): Mica, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491), Iron Oxides (Ci 77492), Iron Oxides (Ci 77499), Aluminum Powder (Ci 77000), Bismuth Oxychloride (Ci 77163), Bronze Powder (Ci 77400), Chromium Hydroxide Green (Ci 77289), Chromium Oxide Greens (Ci 77288), Copper Powder (Ci 77400), Ferric Ammonium Ferrocyanide (Ci 77510), Ferric Ferrocyanide (Ci 77510), Manganese Violet (Ci 77742), Ultramarines (Ci 77007), Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090), Yellow 5 Lake (Ci 19140).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Customize your coverage with the two-sided applicator:Use the sponge side to apply this medium to full coverage powder foundation all over face.Use the velvety side for softer coverage or targeted areas.
ingredients: Dimer Dilinoleyl Dimer Dilinoleate. May Contain (+/-): Mica

reviews.headline: Surprisingly one of my new favorites
reviews.comments: I've never tried a powder foundation before and this is so beautiful. I love that you can use it as a sheer powder or build for more coverage, but it really evens my skin tone out nicely without being heavy. I would recommend buying in store if you're not sure on color, I would consider myself to have warm toned skin but in Estee Lauder products my best matches are all in their cool toned range (I was actually shocked).

reviews.headline: Love this stuff
reviews.comments: Had used this EL DOUBLE WEAR liquid foundation years ago in the same shade, but since moving to a more humid climate, I needed something that won't melt off through the day. Tried the Bare Minerals but the EL was much more natural and better coverage.

reviews.headline: Beautiful finish
reviews.comments: Love the coverage and the finish.

reviews.headline: Beautiful Matte Coverage without Cake
reviews.comments: I apply with a foundation brush to prevent cabinets. Its great for a light dusting over foundation or to touch up and mattify your current look.

reviews.headline: Switching Brands
reviews.comments: I have worn the shade 1N2 Ecru for 25+ years and it was  a perfect match, but based on the reviews of how Estee Lauder has changed the shades to make them darker and more orange, I don't trust Estee Lauder to continue ordering anymore refills! Time to look for a dupe in another brand.

reviews.headline: BREAKOUT BAD 58 yr old
reviews.comments: DO NOT USE Reformulated recently. I feel like they're doing it to try to catch up with all the other powders and they've just made it worse because it's not free of anything Never in my life have I ever had pimples on my face. I am a very long time loyal Estée Lauder customer. I just went to purchase more because I was out in love and behold totally broke my face out really bad. Had to go to the doctor. I should be reimbursed. I am stopping all Estée Lauder products unfortunately that makes me sad. I have to start all over to find something I can trust I do not recommend this product. After using for a week, I broke out and I've stopped using it and I'm still breaking out and after research they have ref formulated this in April 2025.

reviews.headline: New Shades
reviews.comments: I have worn 2W2 Rattan for years,  but I can now no longer wear this shade. When I applied my new 2W2 Rattan powder, it made my face look ORANGE! Since the powder is not available in an Ulta store, I will not be able to find a different shade in person. I guess I am going to a different store or switching brands. Either way, I am extremely disappointed in Estee Lauder.

reviews.headline: Color Much Darker
reviews.comments: I agree with some other reviewers...I've been wearing Pure Beige for many years and it was perfect.  The new formulation is WAY darker. Tried going to a lighter shade, actually tried several other shades but couldn't match the old Pure Beige.  Changed to Lancôme "Buff" 220 and it matches the old Pure Beige and I actually like the softer, "blurred" finish better.  Sorry to leave Estee Lauder.

reviews.headline: Not what it used to be
reviews.comments: I have worn this powder foundation for many decades, but now it seems the formula is so overdrying that it makes me look 20 years older, even with moisturizer and primer! The powder accentuated every single fine lines on my face so bad that I returned the compact and went with another brand.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again
reviews.comments: It's been working for me so far and it doesn't shine as much, because I have oily skin.

reviews.headline: I would not buy this again
reviews.comments:
I would not buy this product again.
1. Color was off
2. This is more like a pressed powder
3. No coverage

reviews.headline: The formula change…
reviews.comments: The previous poster is correct, the formula change ruined what was a great product. The color is darker in the same shade and the wear is also not  as beautiful. I don't know why companies do this to their products and lose long and loyal customers.

reviews.headline: Color Changed
reviews.comments: I have been using pure beige for a decade. The one I received today is marked pure beige, but significantly darker and orange. It also didn't go on evenly like it used to. What happened?!?!?

reviews.headline: Don't fix what ain't broke
reviews.comments: Had to rebuy my powder foundation after losing and got the recently updated compact in my summer shade, 4N1. I use with the matching liquid foundation and have never had an issue with oxidation or worring about color match until I realized it was a whole shade darker that gave me an orange undertone look. It was so bad I can't use it at all or fix with my loose powder. Annoyed that they changed the formula but recommend going a shade lighter than what you'd typically get.

reviews.headline: AMAZING!!
reviews.comments: I have been through so many foundations! Fenty, bare minerals, all drug store, urban decay, IT cosmetics, tarte, literally any you can name! This product blows everything out of the water! It's amazing! It sits perfectly on the skin!

reviews.headline: Don't believe good reviews
reviews.comments: This is no different than the older version, still shows texture galore, (longer it's on, worse it gets), and has a sheen, it's not matte. I was hopeful after reading all these great reviews, but will need to continue search… If you have pore less, beautiful skin to begin with, this may work for you.

reviews.headline: Will buy again
reviews.comments: This sets your make up well

media.headline: Flawless, Matte, and Long-Lasting–My Go-To Powder Foundation
Flawless, Matte, and Long-Lasting–My Go-To Powder Foundation
I really liked the fact that it is waterproof, so it is not
I really liked the fact that it is waterproof, so it is not

faceoff_positive.comments: I cannot say enough good things about this powder foundation. It's one of those rare products that completely lives up to the hype. From the first application, I was hooked. The formula is silky and smooth, gliding onto the skin effortlessly and giving an airbrushed matte finish that still looks natural. It instantly blurs imperfections, evens out my skin tone, and gives me a polished look without ever feeling heavy or cakey. What really makes it stand out is the staying power — this foundation truly lives up to the "stay-in-place" promise. I've worn it through long workdays, outdoor events, and even during hot, humid weather, and it holds up beautifully without oxidizing or breaking apart. I also love that it works just as well on its own as it does layered over my liquid foundation when I want more coverage. It doesn't settle into lines or emphasize texture, and it keeps my T-zone shine-free without drying out other areas. The compact is elegant, lightweight, and comes with a mirror, making it perfect for keeping in my bag for touch-ups throughout the day (though, to be honest, I rarely need to touch up). I just wish it wasn't sold out so often — that's how amazing it is. If you can get your hands on it, do it. This has become a holy grail product for me, and I don't see myself switching anytime soon.
faceoff_positive.headline: Matte Perfection in a Compact

faceoff_negative.comments:
I've been wearing 1N2 Ecru Double Wear foundation for years. This powder is way lighter in color, making me almost a ghost. However, as the day has worn on, this afternoon it has turned darker and has given me more color. Perhaps it's the tint others have complained of, of being orange. I don't see it as orange-tinted but it definitely turned darker. In this case, it's a good thing I guess. 

I also did not receive the two sided applicator as stated and I checked everywhere for it as I had also ordered lipstick and received the freebies that came with my order. I used a makeup brush which was okay but I guess I need to go get a washable sponge so that I can press it on instead of brushing it on. It took quite a bit of brushing on as I was being careful to not over-do it.

I'm 74 so I have my share of wrinkles and the larger pores that come with aging. I will give it credit that it doesn't seem to emphasize the wrinkles or settle into them much and it does seem to help mitigate the pores. However, using a light touch with the Double Wear foundation and a light puffing of my pearl powders on top achieves the same result. 

I do like having a light, easy way to put some color on my face and cover some of the marks of uneven coloration of my skin, especially if I'm not going out for the day but still want to look presentable when I walk my dog in the morning. I'm not sure that this will be the answer and I will likely try some other brands once I run out of this although I will go to the counter to figure out colors and see what the coverage might be. I do hope that they don't change the formula for their foundation. It's perfect as it is.
faceoff_negative.headline: It's Okay but doesn't match my Double Wear foundation
